page.title: 01A GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: This block lies 200'-500'a.s.l.where the valleys of two streams drain from NE to SW.It is gently rolling farmland divided up by hedges and roads into fields,copses,farmsteads and villages. Country roads criss-cross but the road pattern is dominated by the A.303,a major route E-W dividing the area physically and socially into two parts.The population is concentrated into 4 village/hamlets containing working farms and many old farmhouses and thatched cottages. A picture may be forming in your mind of an idyllic rural scene;a population living off the land; an area offering the newcomer freedom to breathe fresh air,walk or ride at will:in short an area of rural peace. Read on to find a different scene, elements of rural contentment exist along side those causing friction.
